meanings.definition: A group of large carnivorous dinosaurs belonging to the family Tyrannosauridae.
The tyrannosaurids were known for their large size and powerful jaws.
Scientists have discovered several species of tyrannosaurids in North America.
The tyrannosaurids lived during the Late Cretaceous period.
Fossils of tyrannosaurids have provided valuable information about the behavior and anatomy of these dinosaurs.
